p: Sardinella aurita is a migratory small pelagic schooling species. The species occurs along the continental shelf between Morocco and Guinea Bissau [ 28]. Recent findings support the separability of the stock into sub-populations [ 29â€“ 33], with one group along Senegal and Southern Mauritania. Spawning in Senegal peaks in fall and spring [ 34]. We focus our research on this subpopulation. We tested for an effect of the more Northern Mauritanian sub-population on Senegalese catches, but found no significant effect.
